description: Ancient Greek to be like the liver, to be liver-coloured: compare English hepatite, and (for sense 2) French hépatiser.

verbs.description: hepatize (third-person singular simple present hepatizes, present participle hepatizing, simple past and past participle hepatized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To impregnate with sulphureted hydrogen gas (formerly called hepatic gas).
examples: On the right  […]  were two wells of hepatized water.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To gorge with effused matter, as the lungs.
(transitive) To convert into a substance resembling liver.
